website_summaries.verdict: An efficient and useful tool, ideal for speeding up your planting and useful for those heavy mixing jobs.
pros: Will fit any 3/8-inch drill or larger
May increase your planting speed by an impressive 500 percent
Can drill holes in all types of soil
cons: Not as powerful as some users would like

customer_reviews.title: Love this thing.
customer_reviews.text: I absolutely love this auger. I bought it because I bought forty tulip bulbs which I was planning on planting in hard clay soil. It took me about 45 minutes to plant all of the bulbs. It drilled through the clay like it was soft loam, ripped through tree roots and piled all the dirt next to the hole. Just keep a firm grip on the drill, preferably with two hands, because this baby rips. I had so much fun. and so much time left over, that I ended up buying 150 daffs and 200 crocus bulbs. I am looking forward to spring and using this auger to plant my vegetable seedlings.
customer_reviews.author: David Sauer

customer_reviews.title: I can't wait for spring
customer_reviews.text: I ordered 200 bulbs and as soon as I hit the confirmation button I wondered "what was I thinking"! We live in the mountains and the soil can be rocky. This tool made the job so much easier- I was done in hours, not days. Suggestions: have as many batteries charged up as possible. I went through a lot! Do be very careful of the drill spinning quickly in your hand when it hits a rock. I used my legs to anchor the drill so my wrist wouldn't snap and ended up with bruises on the inside of my lower calf. I still think this Power Planter is well worth it.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Surpassed expectations
customer_reviews.text: I used this to dig footings underneath an existing ground-level deck. I am building a kitchen on top of my deck, and realized I should add an extra beam for support. There is less than 2 feet of clearance under the deck, so I could not bring in a traditional auger or post hole digger. Removing deck boards was also not an option. So I tried this, and it far exceeded expectations. I ended up digging 20" deep, 9" diameter. This allowed me to break up the dirt, then remove by hand. I used a 10mm deep socket plus extensions to get the depth I needed.
customer_reviews.author: JasonTop Contributor: Baby

customer_reviews.title: Saves so much energy
customer_reviews.text: My soil is hard clay in some areas and filled with tree roots in others. It was tough digging with a shovel, spade or any other tool. This auger is strong and wide enough to loosen soil easily and it does a great job. Sometimes it gets caught in roots, but just reverse your drill and your out. It saves LOTS of time and LOTS of energy. On occasion, it slips, but I just tighten the drill and get on with it.
customer_reviews.author: Steve Says

customer_reviews.title: Great Tool
customer_reviews.text: I ordered this auger to see if it would dig holes in the "dirt" around our house that is full of rocks and small to medium roots. You have to be careful because this tool really digs in and can rip the drill right out of you hands. But the auger cut through the small roots and small rocks very easily and allowed us to plant our flowers and plants very easily. After digging through the rocks, roots, and dirt, the auger is still in perfect condition minus a little paint. I would highly recommend this auger.
customer_reviews.author: Judd-SCC

customer_reviews.title: Be careful
customer_reviews.text: It's ok but be careful. The instructions say to use the slowest drill setting. My drill would not turn the auger unless it was set on "drill" setting which is the highest. When the auger jams against harder dirt, the auger stops and the whole drill spins in your hand. The result is your wrist gets wrenched and twisted. I suppose it's ok for loose dirt, but then why would you need an auger?
customer_reviews.author: Doc Joe

customer_reviews.title: Soft metal, questioning longevity but giving it another chance
customer_reviews.text: Worked great at first and i definitely see the value in having this auger handy but after the first 30 minutes of use i noticed that the hex bit was already stripping. Soft soil, no rocks, and secured tightly in my drill. Took my time and went slow especially after reading a few of the reviews mentioning that the auger kicked back if they hit a rock. Don't get me wrong, the auger saved me some time today but I am not too sure about the durability and longevity. The metal seems too soft to be stripping with minimal use. I do plan on ordering another one because I want this to work.
customer_reviews.author: Win

customer_reviews.title: Excellent auger for rocky ground
customer_reviews.text: Extremely pleased with this auger, first time purchase of this type of product and was concened that it would work in my rocky ground. The video that was provided by the seller was very useful in terms of how to use the auger. I was planting a 40 foot row of bulbs and needed to creat a trough to put the bulbs in and this saved a lot of back breaking work. I highly recommend this item as a time saver for all backyard planting.
customer_reviews.author: Mark G.

customer_reviews.title: Great product!
customer_reviews.text: We live in Northwest Arkansas and have the hardest, rockiest ground I have ever seen. It's impossible to use a shovel to dig a hole for a plant! This auger ate through the dirt very quickly and efficiently, leaving loose soil that will be easy to mix in good dirt and fertilizer. I found it easier to drill in multiple shallow spurts, because if you hit larger rocks or roots, the drill will twist out of your hand. Taking small bites worked perfectly! I love this product!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great tool for planting flower bulbs
customer_reviews.text: Bought this to plant flower bulbs in the fall. Totally easy to use. However, I strongly encourage the use of a drill with a second side handle vs. the traditional single handle drill. The thing can really torque. I've heard people say they injured a wrist using a single handle drill. I can now see how that would be easy to do.
customer_reviews.author: steven k.. schalig

customer_reviews.title: HEAVY duty, solid construction, hex end (as advertised) and busted through packed clay with ease!
customer_reviews.text: I recently received my auger and couldn't be more impressed. I wish I had bought it years ago. Well worth the cost, this is a very heavy chunk of metal that drilled through my packed clay ground with ease! The trick is going slow and lifting the auger up a little to clear some dirt out before pressing down again. Otherwise, in hard packed clay, the auger will just continue to drill down into the ground like a screw, instead of kicking out evacuated dirt/clay. The only thing that will slow auger down are large rocks and roots. Other than that, it burrows easily through everything!
customer_reviews.author: reVamp

customer_reviews.title: Didn't work at all for me
customer_reviews.text: Wouldn't even dig an inch. Using an 18V dewalt drill. I think my wrist would break before it would dig a hole. If you're going to go this route get one smaller!!
customer_reviews.author: Joshua M.

customer_reviews.title: works as advertised
customer_reviews.text: Planted 200 daffodils and 300 tulips in about four hours over a two week period. Important thing to remember is to use your drill at slow speed. You can plant ten bulbs in about five minutes when you do them in clumps. Would buy again and highly recommend it. Better than the longer augur because you get more torque.
customer_reviews.author: Melton R.

customer_reviews.title: I really like this digger
customer_reviews.text: I really like this digger. It helps me for planting, especially in hard soil. It digs fast. When using your half inch drill, be sure to hold drill with both hands. If the digger grabs a root or big rock it will twist your wrist in a split second. Be careful there. Otherwise this thing works.
customer_reviews.author: B. cabaniss

customer_reviews.title: I've got several of these!!
customer_reviews.text: It beats the hell out of using a shovel or spade! I go around with my drill and these auger bits and it makes for a quick planting session! I'm able to plant hundreds of flowers and plants in a day without killing my back, knees or getting blisters all over my hands.
customer_reviews.author: Christopher E. Hodgen

customer_reviews.title: Great promise but third grade product
customer_reviews.text: Was very happy when I got this planter. I have seen others use similar planters and I was very excited to use this. Fits in drill...no problem. Dig the first hole like knife through butter Dig the second hole...smooth going...hit a small stone, click and planter broke off a half inch piece from the front. Was awesome while it lasted...all of 2-3 minutes.
customer_reviews.author: riposte

customer_reviews.title: It worked great for me.
customer_reviews.text: I just put in 90 tulip bulbs and it worked great. I would hit pockets of clay and some stones, but had no problem. Instructions tell you to set your drill on high screw setting, not on drill. When you get stuck, the drill slips and you can just lift it up out of the hole and reinsert. I think it will work great for planting annuals too. Perfect hole size.
customer_reviews.author: Fred B.

customer_reviews.title: Great Tool
customer_reviews.text: Better than expected. Used it to soften rock hard dirt to drive lighting stakes into the ground. Be careful to not spin it too fast. Ouch!
customer_reviews.author: Steven D.

customer_reviews.title: Great tool
customer_reviews.text: Used it to plant a few hundred English oak truffle tree seedlings and it worked great. I like that it is 3” diameter, bigger than a standard bulb planter.
customer_reviews.author: Dominion Decks

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy great product.  Worked like a charm
customer_reviews.text: I am trying to landscape a side of hill. No black dirt in this area, all red clay. This was one of the best purchases I have ever made. I used this to make 150 holes to plant small shrubs. Only took me two hours. My nephew tried helping by using a shovel, he was only able to do ten holes in the time I did 150.
customer_reviews.author: CYNTHIA HUNT

customer_reviews.title: Worth it.
customer_reviews.text: I'm only one season in but I love this thing. Used it for a whole lot of bulbs , and will use it in the spring for nursery bought perennials. I have semi clay soil, and it's a new construction build so I definitely hit some brick, stone, and concrete that were buried in the ground. It did nothing to this auger except mess up the paint a little. I cleaned it off and sprayed some fresh paint on it to hopefully prevent rust. It helps to rest the drill on the side of your leg to prevent it torquing your wrist. I would recommend. I can't imagine digging 50 holes by hand when you can have this instead.
customer_reviews.author: Shane C

customer_reviews.title: Power Planter 3"x12" DIY Guru Auger
customer_reviews.text: Arrived very promptly, well packaged with good instruction insert in the box. I used it with my cordless drill with a 1/2 inch chuck. It is very impressive, very effective, and easy to use. To dig a wider hole I simply put three holes in the ground in a close triangle then moved it about a little. Highly recommended, especially if getting down on your knees to dig and plant is an issue.
customer_reviews.author: Raedwulf

customer_reviews.title: AMAZING
customer_reviews.text: This little drill attachment is AMAZING! We have planted 93 plants in our garden this year, and this tool made a HUGE difference in the time it took. My husband would auger-out the hole, and I'd stick the plant in and cover it up. By the time I finished, the next hole was dug! Full disclosure, the garden HAD been tilled, but the holes still had to be dug. You could tell as soon as it came out of the box that it was sturdy and well made. HIGHLY RECOMMEND!!
customer_reviews.author: Donna Rogers

customer_reviews.title: If you like to garden, you can’t live another day without this.
customer_reviews.text: This auger is amazing, consistent with what others have written about it. I wanted to naturalize some areas on our property in CT- we have lots of rocks, roots and a variety of soil types on our property. This auger worked really well- I planted over 350 2 1/2” plugs in about 10 hours over two days. I created holes 8” wide and 8” deep by drilling 3 overlapping holes as the auger itself is 3” diameter. Planting time included drilling, laying in planting medium, and watering. I could never have done all of this planting with a shovel. A major benefit is that I had no hand pain after all of that. I’m amazed and excited to plant more!
customer_reviews.author: Sempe

customer_reviews.title: Second time around
customer_reviews.text: Worked pretty good until it broke. I wouldn't recommend this for clay soils. Forget it if you hits roots. Shaft bent several times and had to be straightened. Drilled about 25 holes and the hex shaft sheared off where it's welded to the steel tube of the auger. Probably broke from the bending stress. I bought another one to finish the project I'm doing and hopefully it holds up.
customer_reviews.author: Ray

customer_reviews.title: Got the work done!
customer_reviews.text: I used this product to dig a foot hole for a gate post. The heavy duty auger that’s used for that would set me back to about $250. As the video shows it got the work done. I used a shovel to dig as far as I could and the augur did the rest. I could have dug deeper if I needed to. Worked well with my 20 volt black and decker screw driver drill. Very easy to install, not heavy at all (important for back pain sufferers) and am pretty happy! For the price, this is a really good buy.
customer_reviews.author: Joy

customer_reviews.title: Deep Tiller
customer_reviews.text: I bought this device to help improve the quality of my garden soil. I have poor soil and need to get the hard packed clay loosened and be able to get water and compost down to the roots. Used the auger the last 2 days and fine it works as I hoped. Thanks
customer_reviews.author: Richard Burris

customer_reviews.title: works very well
customer_reviews.text: I drove this with a Milwaukee brushless 1/2" M18 cordless drill (non-hammer). The 1/2" has a stabilizer handle which is 'required' as it generates so much torque. I reckon I planted 3-400 bulbs in 2 2 hour sessions and the auger worked perfectly. I could vary the depth easily and put it as a 'must have'
customer_reviews.author: Zippo

customer_reviews.title: Gardener must have!
customer_reviews.text: This auger will be an absolute great buy for any gardener. It makes hole digging for planting so much quicker and easier than toiling with a trowel or spade. Spring bulb planting was a breeze this year, I will never go back to the pain staking manual hole digging. I wish I discovered this auger earlier but I am sure I will have lots of uses for it next year and beyond.
customer_reviews.author: A. Dennis

customer_reviews.title: Fabulous tool
customer_reviews.text: LOVE this tool. The project required digging down 48 inches (frost line) to pour a concrete base. This is glacier territory and there are more rocks than soil. Using a shovel is not possible because of the rocks. This tool has surprised me in its sturdiness and ability to dislodge the rocks. It has made this project possible. With common sense and a slow drive with the drill the rocks do not fly out but instead drop to the bottom to be scooped out. This is an amazing tool. After completing the first hole, it is still sharp and ready for more. I highly recommend this tool!
customer_reviews.author: artlover

customer_reviews.title: Auger
customer_reviews.text: It digs very well but you should not only have a hefty drill but a drill that has another side handle (which I do) because when it hits a big root or something it can torque your wrist without a side handle. Not an item for a small child or a lady with a weak wrist and I don't mean that negatively about the item but just simply the amount of torque an 18V drill will have when it stops suddenly. Between the auger, the drill, and your wrist, the wrist is the weakest item.
customer_reviews.author: William C. May

customer_reviews.title: Great garden helper.
customer_reviews.text: Very good and helpful product. I used it to dig up and mix “landscape and growers mix” in 2 flower beds. The dirt here is tight clay and hard to till. It loosened up soil and then I used it to mix together product above. Only caution, which is notated in instructions, need to use drill with side handle or if none available, support drill tightly with both hands!!! Do not hold in one hand only!!! Could twist wrist and hurt you. Very safe if use on slow speed and follow instructions. Love this garden helper.
customer_reviews.author: Jumper

customer_reviews.title: Nice!!!!
customer_reviews.text: Excellent Product. Arrived on time and used to plant 30 day lilies in about one hour. Used in Georgia clay at noon with one inch rain received overnite. Used with Ryobi 18 volt lithium battery drill on low speed. Important to go slow and lift often to bring dirt out of hole. Easily cut through small roots. Had used post hole digger in past and this was much faster and easier.
customer_reviews.author: Shirley

customer_reviews.title: Perfect tool for the job
customer_reviews.text: I thought this item was perfect for what I needed and worked just as expected. I was initially planting tomatoes using a gas powered auger, but this was way overkill and a lot of work. I purchased this little auger, put it in my corded drill and things went much better. It was the perfect size for digging sand loosening soil in a short amount of time - much easier and more precise than both a small shovel and larger auger.
customer_reviews.author: K. Mac

customer_reviews.title: Not Useful for Planting
customer_reviews.text: I really wanted to love this product. I plant a lot of bulbs every fall, and this seemed like a perfect way to make the process go more quickly. However, unless you are literally digging a hole in potting soil, this tool is useless. After you have dug the hole, it does a pretty good job of softening the dirt that’s been dug out. I even tried it out on a flower bed that has been dug and planted several times a season for years and it wasn’t able to dig deeper than a two inch hole. We usually plant this bed with a small trowel the soil is so soft. Don’t waste your money.
customer_reviews.author: ReadingTchr

customer_reviews.title: Do Not Use in Hard Soil !
customer_reviews.text: Absolute junk. Broke on first try when using in hard clay soil ( Georgia )...Auger is still lodged deep in ground . I have a half an inch left of bit...
customer_reviews.author: Nicolas Peplinski

customer_reviews.title: Wonderful tool
customer_reviews.text: I am a senior citizen so I've had to change the way I garden. I found the tool a little heavy at first but I put it in my drill and planted in my clay soil with ease. I wish I had known about this tool years ago. I can't wait to plant my fall bulbs. It will be with ease this time. I will tell all my friends about it.
customer_reviews.author: Andrea C.

customer_reviews.title: BEST GARDEN TOOL EVER!!
customer_reviews.text: WOW!!!! This is by far the best Garden tool I have ever purchased! I have a bad back and neck which really prohibits me from doing as much as I would like to do. I put in 95 bulbs in less than an hour! ( in lousy soil) before I would have been lucky to get 15 bulbs in and have to take a break. I can’t wait for spring!!!!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: I returned it; did not do what was described
customer_reviews.text: I join few others who said this auger doesn't work in hard packed ground. I found it didn't even dig down in semi-hard packed dirt. Our soil is quite sandy, and according to the description for the auger, it could easily go through it. No, it didn't. I tried several times, adjusted my drill according to the directions, still didn't work for me.
customer_reviews.author: NanaCA

customer_reviews.title: Works OK
customer_reviews.text: Got it to use in a DeWalt DCD985B to loosen up the dirt for follow up with a manual post hole digger. It was subjected some moderate resistance from roots, even got yanked out of the drill once. It did what I bought it for, so no complaints here.
customer_reviews.author: Percy Smogg

customer_reviews.title: Powerful drill meets awesome auger
customer_reviews.text: Double review. I bought this auger and drill to punch some holes in my very rocky, heavy clay lawn soil. Sort of a lawn aeration on steroids. Auger chewed through the heavy soil with no problems, but did need to be paired up with a strong drill. I started with a basic Craftsman 6 amp and almost killed it. Only gripe with the auger is that is sometimes spun out of the drill, but not too often. The drill is very strong and thankfully has a dial to control the torque. The 2 handles feel a bit cheap and plastic, but minor issue.
customer_reviews.author: oldmanjersey

customer_reviews.title: Worked like a charm
customer_reviews.text: My husband's favorite thing is not working out in the lawn. So when he ordered this item to plant some shurbs I had purchased I thought it was over kill. Boy was I wrong!!! This drilled through the soil, and tree roots so quickly we were done in no time. I know without it, it would have required more time and a lot more effort. When he turned around and asked me, "Hey, do you want to go buy some more plants?" I was sold!!! Thank you my yard looks great!!!!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: WOW!
customer_reviews.text: Absolutely fantastic tool, that will save you hours of work and a sore back! My husband immediately went to get his drill and tried it out in the yard. Amazing! Easy to use, definitely does the job and is a quality tool. We are looking forward to planting everything, at our new house after we close in April 2019!
customer_reviews.author: Tanya Eckles

customer_reviews.title: Heavy duty auger bit works great!
customer_reviews.text: I love this! I have fibromyalgia & very hard to dig large holes in yard to plant small trees or plants like oleanders. You have to do a little bit at a time but it is really powerful. Works like a dream, doesn't take long to dig a hole by moving the auger bit around the area you want to dig. Saves me aches & pains too! One of the absolute best garden tools I have ever bought & I am an avid gardener! Plus the soil is a clay mix but this auger works right through! Love it!
customer_reviews.author: Succulent Lady TX

customer_reviews.title: Useful, but it's a wrist breaker
customer_reviews.text: Love the concept, but should be used by very strong people or only in softer, unpacked soil. As soon as there is resistance, it wrenches backwards on your wrist HARD. I had it happen twice while I used it, and that was it. I had to return it. Bummer.
customer_reviews.author: Kimmie S

customer_reviews.title: Enables super fast planting - get the longer version if your work is spread out
customer_reviews.text: These are simply amazing. I like them so much, that after I got this one, I got the 7"x28" and the 3" x24". The one caution I'd offer is if you are covering lots of ground, get the longer version (24") so you can drill all your holes without kneeling at each site. If you have a compact planter bed, the shorter version is less cumbersome to operate while sitting or kneeling. FWIW, I use a Dewalt 20v hammer drill with the side handle and the clutch set to 11. I can drill >25 holes 12" deep in clay on a 3ah battery with a full charge. Planting was never so easy.
customer_reviews.author: D. Hackenson

customer_reviews.title: Should work great.
customer_reviews.text: Much heavier duty than expected. Should work great in our clay-soil. I'm glad I read the review about getting it longer to avoid dirt from blowing up onto the drill.
customer_reviews.author: JStuart

customer_reviews.title: OMG This works so awesome
customer_reviews.text: As you can see from the video our ground is very rocky. Dug to place the wood edging for white chip decorative ground cover. This thing powered right through the rocks and all!! Made this job so much faster and easier. Absolutely recommend!!!
customer_reviews.author: Tiffany Mancao

customer_reviews.title: Great product!!!!
customer_reviews.text: Where has this been all my life. I didn’t even know these existed. It works perfectly and really makes planting SO MUCH easier! No more shovels!!! Would definitely recommend this product. It is sturdy and attaches to my drill very easily!
customer_reviews.author: Scott

customer_reviews.title: Think about your soil
customer_reviews.text: This is sturdy and well made. That being said it is also heavy and when attached to a drill its quite heavy. It is as powerful as your drill motor and what type of soil you are going through. I was planting along our stone walls which had some tree roots and if would jam. When the soil was just dirt it worked well. You also have to kneel or bend over each time which is a little bit achy. I found a shovel worked better and was easier. Kudos to company it made a quality product, and idea was good but execution not so much.
customer_reviews.author: de by

customer_reviews.title: Auger works well for planting bukbs
customer_reviews.text: I used this auger to plant bulbs. Seems to work well. Much more efficient than a shovel, pick or a bulb planter (my bulb planter was bent out of shape before I was halfway done :) ). Just be careful, if you are going too fast and hit a rock it will sling your arm around.
customer_reviews.author: Billie Foster

customer_reviews.title: I use this tool to till my raised garden beds
customer_reviews.text: I could not love this item more!. I do plant bulbs with it but I mostly use it to till by soil on the raised beds and initially to do the Mell's mix (compost, vermiculite and coco fiber). Anyone that has read the Square foot gardening book would know.
customer_reviews.author: Rosailin

customer_reviews.title: I love this
customer_reviews.text: This auger is wonderful. It is heavy as it needs to be to dig in my red clay yard. Now I can get things planted so much easier. I was going to buy a cheaper one but it took a month to ship and I wanted it now to use. I am so not sorry I spent a little more to get this one. It is a quality product and if it ever breaks I will get another one from the same company. I highly doubt it will ever break though.
customer_reviews.author: rocketdogmom

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy
customer_reviews.text: Solid tool. Better with corded drill. Used all day planting asiatic jasmine. Was worth price just for one day. Recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Pink G.

customer_reviews.title: Somewhat Useful
customer_reviews.text: This product is a good idea but it doesn't work as well on soil that hasn't been planted in a while. I needed to use a spade to dig out the ground and used the Guru Augur to help brake up some of the compacted soil once I started digging. I'm planting an area that was neglected by the previous owners of my home. This tool would be of better use to soil that isn't as compacted.
customer_reviews.author: Barbara

customer_reviews.title: Makes planting easier
customer_reviews.text: We just recently bought a house in Georgia and have mostly "red dirt" with rocks. A lot of people may know it as "red clay". We also live in a rural area with a lot of trees and roots so this tool saved my marriage by providing a way to dig the holes for my plants. We did discover you really need to be holding on tight when you hit a root so that it doesn't tangle and/or slant off of the direction you want to dig. Would highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Dorothy W.

customer_reviews.title: It's okay...
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this device to connect to my 3/8" corded drill, to dig into hard, clay soil, to mix in compost, and to dig down about 12" for planting gallon container flowers and shrubs. I was hoping this would make it easier than using a shovel for the task. Unfortunately it just doesn't really make the task significantly easier. For a recent planting, I ended up setting it aside and returning to the shovel, with which I could more efficiently break up the clods. I have unfortunately been busy and waited too long to return it. Hopefully I'll find some use for it.
customer_reviews.author: Mark

customer_reviews.title: Best bulb tool ever.
customer_reviews.text: Wow! I can not give enough to those to this device. This thing took hours to days off my gardening. I bought 1000 daffodil bulbs and could not believe how hard it was to plant them by shovel. I bought this thing and I got it done in three four hour days. Make certain you have at least two batteries for your drill so that you can charge Well Drilling otherwise it will take much longer but if you only have a few bulbs or few items you can do it in about an hour fully charged battery
customer_reviews.author: Scott Madison

customer_reviews.title: Digs great.
customer_reviews.text: Finally got to try the Auger out. First tip. Wear gloves. Set drill on Low speed. Make sure the Auger is chucked up firmly in the drill. Start drill before contacting the soil. Slowly lower until you've about an inch or two deep. Withdraw to clear soil from tool. Repeat several times till desired depth is reached. Be aware that roots and rocks underground can cause the Auger to move wildly up or down. Take it slow is the way to go.
customer_reviews.author: Leonard A.

customer_reviews.title: It works a lot easier than a shovel.
customer_reviews.text: It works a lot easier than a shovel. Outside able to use it or rather my son to play some Gladiola. It only took about 15 minutes to play 25 Gladiola. The only problem we had was where to drill the holes to put the Gladiolas in...my 3/8 drill was underpowelled. I’m going to have to get the hammer drill and I’ve been wanting for a while now. Now I have a reason to buy it. This just make much easier to plant Bulbs now,.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great Product
customer_reviews.text: I really like this product and have used it in digging 20-28" holes for replanting burning bushes. While there is not a shortcoming of the product, I find that a support bar on the side of the drill is very important no matter how strong you are. This is a great addition to my landscaping tools
customer_reviews.author: R W F

customer_reviews.title: Easily handled rocky red Georgia clay!
customer_reviews.text: I live in Georgia and most of my new planting beds are nothing but red clay and rocks. I'm a 63 year old woman and, with a bad back and hip, I thought I was going to have to start paying someone to do my gardening and planting. But this auger has made it possible for me to continue doing it by myself! Well worth the price!!
customer_reviews.author: Flowery Branch Girl

customer_reviews.title: Sprinkler repair time saver
customer_reviews.text: I use it to dig up broken sprinklers. It's much easier than using a regular shovel.
customer_reviews.author: David Russell

customer_reviews.title: Worked Great, fixed my problem
customer_reviews.text: I was digging supports for my already installed deck under the deck. This worked out great in the tight spot that I had, about 20". I drilled the holes with the bit then used my shop vac to suck out the dirt from the hole, repeat! I am very pleased with the results!
customer_reviews.author: roaming runkels

customer_reviews.title: Great time saver
customer_reviews.text: We have a very hard clay layer about 6 inches down. I usually use a pick to dig holes for planting. I was skeptical that this auger would work with our ground, but I have to say that I was amazed at how easy it digs into this hard clay layer. I would highly recommend this to anyone that is thinking of purchasing this product. The first time I used this auger I drilled 15 holes in about 5 minutes. This would have been at least an hour job with a pick. I use a corded power drill instead of a battery powered drill as we also have tree roots and rocks to contend with. Very well built.
customer_reviews.author: ralph r.

customer_reviews.title: Disappointing
customer_reviews.text: Good idea but poor materials. The part that goes into the drill stripped within a few minutes of use. Even tried to use a socket and an adapter to get a better bite. Still failed.
customer_reviews.author: Casey

customer_reviews.title: If you plant stuff, just buy it
customer_reviews.text: So I live where the ground is pretty much strictly clay. This has been awesome for breaking up the dirt and making planting much easier. Be careful and go slow because if you do hit a root or a rock, the drill will twist around and could hurt. As long as you are aware of that this will make planting so much easier. I wish I would have bought this years ago!! Totally recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Work good, much better than I expected.
customer_reviews.text: Worked good, you definitely need a variable speed drill. I put it to use, it didn't fall apart for me like others said. Mine was welded fine, you CAN'T expect it to pull out bigger rocks, roots, etc... You have drill slower and meter you speed, you can't use it as if you were drilling through a piece of wood with a bit. Still worked great and eat easier than digging
customer_reviews.author: MAL8585

customer_reviews.title: Small & Mighty
customer_reviews.text: This item works great just as described, please read the instructions before you use it because it will crank your wrist if it gets stuck on something but overall I used it the plant several plants this year in Rocky areas and some easy to plant areas and it really does the job and does the job well. Again read the instructions because it has some solid advice in there how to not break your wrist.
customer_reviews.author: Brett F.

customer_reviews.title: Must have tool for gardeners.
customer_reviews.text: Very durable product made of strong gaged steel. It certainly does the job of breaking up the soil for bulb planting. I am certainly pleased with this product
customer_reviews.author: Ricky J. Chasse

customer_reviews.title: Very sturdy
customer_reviews.text: This thing is amazing. Drills holes clean and fast. I have a garden that is 5ft by 25ft. I used this thing to roto till the garden. I just drilled hoke right next to each other moving down the whole 25ft. Did it in 15 minutes. Whole garden was tilled about a foot deep. Then used it to plant 20 bulbs, drilled clean holes in just a few minutes. I will warn you, hang on to your drill while doing this, if it catches a root or hard ground, the drill will twist in your hands. Definitely would buy again..
customer_reviews.author: Weeburt1

customer_reviews.title: Good hole maker
customer_reviews.text: I haven't used it much, yet. Am using it for holes in hard soil. I attached it to a low geared drill similar to a hole-hawg, and it churned up dirt. When I went through an irrigation line a few holes in, I had to attach it to a ratchet for the other 30 or so holes so that I don't destroy any other utilities. It still made nice deep holes without much effort.
customer_reviews.author: E. Harris

customer_reviews.title: Best garden tool I have ever purchased.
customer_reviews.text: This tool has many uses and can be used to take the hard work out of removing soil around sprinkler heads for maintenance and replacement. Can be used as a cultivator to break up compacted soils in small areas and in large planters, pots and raised beds. Can be used in compost bins to aerate and as a transition border line maker for flower bed and grass areas. It will not do washing or cook dinner but just about anything you need to do in the garden with soil as in mixing amendments... a work saver for sure. Great tool, made well, great materials and made in the USA!
customer_reviews.author: Helix 5

customer_reviews.title: Dangerous??
customer_reviews.text: I purchased shortest auger. While using keyless chuck on my drill which is somewhat awkward because of auger’s weight causing it to be heavy, I’m concerned about how close my hand is to blade. One slip could be real painful.
customer_reviews.author: Alamo 223

customer_reviews.title: Real Hand and Wrist Saver
customer_reviews.text: We only had about 2 dozen bulbs to plant. Not too many but tough on older hands and wrists. Took a couple of holes to get a good technique down then really fast. It has never been easier to plant bulbs. Seems to be well made although some of the auger edges are a bit sharp from being stamped out. Time will tell how durable this is but so far so good.
customer_reviews.author: Richard H

customer_reviews.title: hardy construction & works great
customer_reviews.text: This product works great, just like it is supposed to. I went slow with my drill, so I wouldn't have any wrist mishaps like other reviewers mentioned, but didn't have even a threat of anything. This will be added to my normal garden tools. Cant beat that it is solid and made in the USA! 🇺🇸
customer_reviews.author: Lacy OBrien

customer_reviews.title: Works very well but performs best with a variable speed 1/2 drill
customer_reviews.text: Very well made auger and does the job...even in rocks. Works very well but performs best with a variable speed 1/2 drill. Would buy another if this one mysteriously walked off. The extension that is available would be a nice item to go along with it.. It would be money well spent.
customer_reviews.author: smalltowntex

customer_reviews.title: I dig the Power Planter!
customer_reviews.text: I used the Power Planter to drill large holes for bushes I was moving to a new area and it worked great. When I angled the power planter drill bit more horizontal to the ground, I used it to clear away weeds from the surface of the ground. Both uses worked like a charm. The drill bit is very sturdy. If it gets tangled around some deep roots, just reverse the drill rotation, and the Power Planter comes right out of the ground. It saved me lots of time. Buy this and you won't regret it!!!
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: A Great Investment!
customer_reviews.text: Easy to use right out of the box. A quality made gardening tool made in the USA! We used it to dig holes to set out transplants, i.e. peppers,and tomatoes. Saves time, energy and our backs from digging! We used it to dig 50+ holes. Reasonably priced and I'm certain it will last for many years to come. God bless the folks who invented and manufactured this great tool.
customer_reviews.author: Sherry Anderson

customer_reviews.title: BEST...TOOL...EVER.
customer_reviews.text: Used it for planting seedlings on the tree line...rough soil. I did more in 15 minutes with it, than I did the day before without it. Caution: Use 2 hands always....digs through dirt with ease....but if it snags a root, the drill torque could hurt your wrist if you're not braced properly.
customer_reviews.author: gBarry

customer_reviews.title: Durable Product! Gardening Must Have!
customer_reviews.text: This makes planting a breeze! We've been in an area with a lot of flooding this year and finished our third (and final) attempt for a garden, all with the help of this product. This has cut down planting time immensely and is incredibly durable. If we didnt have it, I'm confident that we would have thrown in the towel after the first round of plants drowned out. I wouldn't go back to digging by hand! Attaches to a Dewalt cordless drill.
customer_reviews.author: Amy M.

customer_reviews.title: Worked well cutting into clay soil when paired with a ...
customer_reviews.text: Worked well cutting into clay soil when paired with a corded Dewalt Drill. Keep two hands on the tool incase you hit a root or rock. I used it to plant 144 grass plugs. Certainly made the job easier. Black paint/ coating wore off in lots area. We'll have to wait and see if it rusts or oxidizes down the road.
customer_reviews.author: Zo76

customer_reviews.title: Easy dig
customer_reviews.text: I could not have done it with a spade. I planted 21 -1 gallon plants and 2- 3 gallon in about 1/2 hour, expanded the hole with the auger and dug the lose dirt with a small shovel or spade. It saved my day.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Worked great and we had to dig 6 of these holes
customer_reviews.text: Used in digging 24" x 28" x 28" deep footers for my patio post's and hitting numerous rocks in the process. Worked great and we had to dig 6 of these holes. Still going strong.
customer_reviews.author: Uncle Mean Man

customer_reviews.title: Get's The Job Done And Fast
customer_reviews.text: I've had bulb augers in the past and haven't been too impressed. This one, however, is outstanding. It blasts through dirt and gets me to a good planting depth in seconds. I would guess it cuts bulb planting time in fourth. It is a little expensive, but it's well worth it. Make sure you have a good, powerful drill.
customer_reviews.author: Rossputin

customer_reviews.title: My favorite!
customer_reviews.text: This auger Quickly became my favorite gardening tool. I have very rocky soil and this auger made planting bulbs a breeze. Remember to use your drill on a slow speed (on high speed when the auger finds a bigger rock, your auger ceases to spin but your wrist continues. Found this out the hard way 😂) The auger spits the small-medium rocks out with no problem. Bigger rocks are easily removed when the auger finds them. I planted 120 bulbs in an hour. This includes the flower bed layout.
customer_reviews.author: Angela Carroll

customer_reviews.title: this device has put joy in my life to be able to play in ...
customer_reviews.text: As a disabled person with very little ability to use my left arm, this device has put joy in my life to be able to play in then garden again. Boring holes is now a joy. What used to take me 10-15 mins. To do now takes me seconds. Great product!
customer_reviews.author: Richard

customer_reviews.title: Solid
customer_reviews.text: Solid and sturdy.My soil is hard and very clayey. This tool busted through it to the point of my heavy duty drill running out of umpppp before the auger shaft or spot welding showed any stress. I have had the cheaper augers in the past without the hex shaft, those are nothing compared to this one.
customer_reviews.author: J. M. Black

customer_reviews.title: Sprint planting made easy
customer_reviews.text: We love this. It has made spring planting much easier. It goes through the little roots nicely but hold on loosely for the big roots. You can tweek your wrist pretty easily.
customer_reviews.author: Bigskidude

customer_reviews.title: Saves so much work!
customer_reviews.text: I used this for an unintended purpose (drilling post holes) and I'm on AZ so I have some rocky, clay like soil. It made it through it all until my drill lit on fire... needed to be replaced anyway (; auger still going strong though in a new brushless impact wrench!
customer_reviews.author: Bryce The King

customer_reviews.title: So far, so good!
customer_reviews.text: Purchased for my wife to aid in her gardening projects. But as it attaches to a power tool, it then becomes my project. Sure beats digging holes with a little pink gardening spade! Run on low speed, don't be a hero if you have a decent drill attached, else it'll wrench your wrist pretty good when it finds a root and stops dead.
customer_reviews.author: Tech Guy

customer_reviews.title: Well beyond my expectations!
customer_reviews.text: You claim the auger is for soft soil. We have the hardest, most rock-impregnated soil in the Rocky Mountains and it is no match for the auger. Even a pick axe cannot do what the auger does. We are so impressed we recommend it to anyone. It has saved us countless hours of hard work with a pick and shovel. It quickly dislodges 4 - 5" stones with no trouble. On deep holes we have to shovel out the initially loosened soil and then use the auger again to get the depth we want. We powered it with a DeWalt 20 volt 1/2" hand drill.
customer_reviews.author: kochjv

customer_reviews.title: Very good performance
customer_reviews.text: Very happy with performance. Be careful to hold onto drill with both hands in case you hit a rock. Can hurt wrist. I have hard rocky soil but this auger cuts through very well and if I move it up and down I frequently don’t need a shovel. Would buy again but don’t need to because it’s holding up well.
customer_reviews.author: Rick

customer_reviews.title: Makes gardening of any kind easy-peasy
customer_reviews.text: This auger is AMAZING for digging, mixing, removing medium roots. I use my husband's 3/4 inch cordless drill with the auger. It works great in red clay. It makes planting so easy! I've even used it to loosen soil around shrubs I wanted to relocate. I am a landscaping machine with this tool! I love it.
customer_reviews.author: SSB

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use and super helpful.
customer_reviews.text: This is great. Definitely get the 12" version. Made planting my bulbs super easy.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Outstanding
customer_reviews.text: Seems to be very well-made and sturdy. Used it this weekend to plan approximately 20 plants/flowers in my flower bed and it is a HUGE time-saver. I don't know how I ever made it without this thing. I used mine with a 20v DeWalt cordless drill and it worked great. I highly recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: Tracy D

customer_reviews.title: Drill Auger
customer_reviews.text: Great product! So much better then the other ones I have bought! The last one I bought that was made in China stripped out in my drill. This one locks in like a clap and no chance of any stripping out the shaft! Would recommend and buy next time a larger bit due to our heavy clay soil!!
customer_reviews.author: Alexfig

customer_reviews.title: This works just as described.
customer_reviews.text: This works great if you have several things to plant. I am very happy with this purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Shelia

customer_reviews.title: A MUST-HAVE Garden Tool
customer_reviews.text: With a new home, there are SO many projects on the "to do" list, and this tool makes quick work of all of the garden projects. Our soil can be tough to dig in, and this tool makes any digging easy. It helps with everything: planting, installing irrigation, in ground solar lights, small garden fences and stakes.
customer_reviews.author: Chris Doble

customer_reviews.title: Works very well once you learn how to use it. Saves a lot of digging.
customer_reviews.text: Auger seems sturdy. Planted about 30 daffodil bulbs in a short time. Don't expect it to be like drilling into wood; you need to use a stabbing motion. You won't always get a perfectly cylindrical hole, but the bulbs/seedlings don't care. Follow the instructions about settings for your drill. Be prepared to stop for stones, roots, etc. Also good for mixing potting soil quickly and thoroughly. Just take the time to acquire a feel for how to use it. Check YouTube for more instructions and demos.
customer_reviews.author: 2moles

product_meta.title: Power Planter 100% USA Made 3"x12" DIY Guru Auger …
feature_bullets: 100% MADE IN THE USA, with USA sourced materials. Made by family farmers for over 30 years for your garden
Quickly and efficiently plant bedding plants and bulbs or mix paint, mortar, or soil in a bucket or wheelbarrow
Non-slip hex drive to fit any 3/8" or larger drill
Lifetime warranty on craftsmanship and materials

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.6 out of 5 stars1,286 ratings4.6 out of 5 stars
